ARTICLE.COMMENT: An interview of BruceChizen: the Adobe/Macromedia merge, non-PC device, Microsoft competition, Apple’s switch to Intel…

X.T: The Font Magicians - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: How JohnWarnock and CharlesGeschke created Adobe and solved the low resolution rasterising problem.

X.T: Here's The Story Of Alibaba's Rise

ARTICLE.COMMENT: There is little information in this history of the company.

X.T: Amazon.com and Beyond

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Bezos speaks about Amazon.

X.T: DEAR AMERICA: It's Time To Say A Big 'Thank You' To Amazon

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author claims that Amazon is doing what the other US companies are not doing anymore: focusing on long-term profit instead of short-term money.

X.T: Amazon Fire TV: World domination through video games
X.ST: Last to arrive to the streaming party, Fire TV has powerful insides, a controller, and the backing of an in-house game studio. But is that enough to set it apart?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Amazon is trying to using games as a differentiator for its Fire TV.

X.T: Your impulse buys are costing Amazon a fortune
X.ST: The online retailer missed Wall Street projections during its all-important holiday quarter, and shipping and fulfillment costs didn't help the situation.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Amazon’s shipping and fulfilment costs keep increasing because of its Prime program.

X.T: Bye, Amazon

ARTICLE.COMMENT: TimBray explains why he resigned from Amazon.

X.T: You Can’t Trust Amazon When It Feels Threatened

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author explains that, because of a lying tweet, he cannot trust Amazon anymore.

X.T: Amazon Alexa is a “colossal failure,” on pace to lose $10 billion this year
X.ST: Layoffs reportedly hit the Alexa team hard as the company's biggest money loser.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all.

X.T: How the U.S. Lost Out on iPhone Work

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The article explains that Apple needs to go in China because, there, the plants are able to react quickly enough and because the supply chain is much better. But all reader comments speak about the very low Chinese wages…

X.T: The TikTok-Oracle Deal Would Set 2 Dangerous Precedents
X.ST: The agreement may provoke a global data storage melee and more politically motivated intervention in the tech sector.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author claims that the agreement would help TikTok focuses on improving its application and that other countries would also impose some local data storage.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: DouglasCrockford speaks about Walt Disney’s dream of creating a city of the future.

X.T: Dropbox: The Inside Story Of Tech's Hottest Startup

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The history of the company.

X.T: Hacker Way: Designing the New Messenger

ARTICLE.COMMENT: How Facebook designed the UI its new Messenger. There is little information here.

X.T: There's A Hidden Message On The Sign Outside Facebook's Campus — It Reminds Employees To Stay Motivated

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Why MarkZuckerberg kept and turned Sun’s sign around.

X.T: Ch-ch-ch-ch-changes

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Yet another example of the strangeness you fill when you join Facebook.

X.T: Agile Africa 2015: Managing By The 'Book - Kent Beck

ARTICLE.COMMENT: KentBeck describes some Facebook values and his difficulties with them when he joined the company.

X.T: If you feel your organization needs a "presence" in Facebook

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some basic good advice for (not) using Facebook.

X.T: How Facebook Engineers Plan To Make Your Experience Faster And More Efficient In 2018
X.ST: Moore’s Law is slowing down, so engineers have to find ways to get more efficiency out of software instead of just waiting for ever-more powerful hardware.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Improving the efficiency of its software, pushing notification, using machine learning internally to help developers reuse code and test…

X.T: The Trauma Floor
X.ST: The secret lives of Facebook moderators in America

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some Facebook’s contractors in charge of content moderation are psychologically impacted.

X.T: Why Facebook Can’t Fix Itself
X.ST: The platform is overrun with hate speech and disinformation. Does it actually want to solve the problem?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information on how Facebook poorly moderate its content.

X.T: WhatsApp Beaten By Apple’s New iMessage Privacy Update

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Facebook does not appreciate that Apple makes clearly visible that WhatsApp collects a lot of user data.

X.T: What Really Caused Facebook's 500M-User Data Leak?
X.ST: The company's explanations have been confusing and inconsistent, but there are finally some answers.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Facebook has not openly and clearly reported the data scraped from its import feature.

X.T: A New Facebook Bug Exposes Millions of Email Addresses
X.ST: A recently discovered vulnerability discloses user email addresses even when they’re set to private.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Yet another way to scrap Facebook data, and Facebook initial reaction was to claim there was no problem.

X.T: The Facebook Whistleblower, Frances Haugen, Says She Wants to Fix the Company, Not Harm It
X.ST: The former Facebook employee says her goal is to help prompt change at the social-media giant

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Yet another resignation and some document leaks about the fact that Facebook cares about user engagement and not about limiting misinformation and harmful content.

X.T: Why Did Facebook Go Down? - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A short description on how Facebook disappeared from Internet for a few hours.

X.T: John Carmack issues some words of warning for Meta and its metaverse plans
X.ST: "But here we are, Mark Zuckerberg has decided that now is the time..."

ARTICLE.COMMENT: JohnCarmack explains that the Metaverse should not be build top-down as a product of one company, but bottom-up by several products, each solving the many remaining technical challenges.

X.T: Trafiquant d'humains et marchand de haine #FacebookFiles

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some examples of Facebook violating laws and ethics to earn more money.

X.T: 2021 was the year the world finally turned on Facebook
X.ST: Can a name change save the company’s tarnished reputation?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Facebook is accumulating problems.

X.T: Facebook loses users for first time ever, market cap drops by $200 billion
X.ST: Meta's earnings call revealed bad news buried within bad news.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all.

X.T: Meta thinks Facebook may need more “harmful health misinformation” [Updated]
X.ST: The oversight board is now fielding public comments on potential policy change.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Facebook would like to re-allow fake medical news.

X.T: After $414M fine, Meta tries to avoid seeking user consent for personalized ads
X.ST: Privacy activists explain why asking for consent may be Meta's only option.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The Irish Data Protection Commission considers that embedding the user consent agreement in the terms of services is violating the GDPR.

X.T: Voyage en Contributopia : ça nous a fait mûrir !

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A look at the successes and failures of Framasoft (as evaluated by themselves).

X.T: Convivialisons Internet, 3 ans pour ouvrir un coin de web nature aux canards sauvages

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The new projects of Framasoft: Emancip’Asso to train some hosting providers and help connect them with associations, Frama.space to provide a cloud workspace to small associations and help them share their practices, the ECHO Network European project to share information about educating people about the GAFAM, and the peer.tube site.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author, a transgender, described her life in and firing from GitHub.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: DmitriyZaporozhets is leaving from GitLab.

X.ST: GTLB stock has a market value of more than $18 billion, but revenue will be just $231 million this year

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: GitLab is getting rid of 7% of its employees.

X.T: Google Defies Dotcom Downturn

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The current status of Google: 8000 PCs running Linux and storing more than one petabyte of data.

X.T: Google
X.ST: While other search engines sputter and fail, Monika Henzinger, Google's director of research, has an answer to every query.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An interview with MonikaHenzinger: the current Google answer ordering methodology, translation, news…

X.T: Google vs. Evil

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Being the leader of search sites implies some moral: the scientology issue, China blockage…

X.T: From Danger's realm come Android's makers
X.ST: Google's Andy Rubin talks nuts and bolts about the Linux-based phone software, the lessons of Sidekick, and the beauty of the iPhone. Google releases Android tools Images: Software tools for Google Android

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An interview of AndyRubin who participated to the Android project.

X.T: Five realities of Google or any other Workplace Wonderland

ARTICLE.COMMENT: It seems that people have started to realise that no company is perfect to work for, event Google.

X.T: Google, sa stratégie et son écosystème, vus par Google France

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A short presentation of Google and a long Q&A session in La Maison des Centraliens.

X.T: Google: "Goggles Does NOT Do Face Recognition"

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google says it will deliver its visual search before the end of the year, but it will not support facial recognition, despite the fact it already has the technology.

X.T: 10 Concerns With Google Instant
X.ST: Instant is a dramatic move and will likely change Web business and how consumers use the Web in a number of ways

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author tries to predict the impact of Google instant search, but, in fact, he has very few things to say and his arguments are not very convincing.

X.T: The Structured Search Engine

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of FreeBase (a semantic knowledge database) and Google Squared (an elements/attributes table generated from Internet data).

X.T: How I Learned to Live Google-free
X.ST: A quest to quit the most pervasive company on the Web

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author tried to not use any Google service anymore, switching to other providers and transferring his data to them.

X.T: [Update] Google knows where you’ve been and they might be holding your encryption keys
X.ST: On the heels of other disturbing stories about Google and privacy and security issues, blogger Donovan Colbert discovered another problem with info that his Android device shares with Google. [Updated post

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A journalist accidentally discovered that Google backups WAP keys and tries to make fuss about it.

X.T: Can Google survive its blind faith in the algorithm?
X.ST: It's been a tough year for Google search. It's had a difficult time targeting content farms and has accidentally removed good content.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google has more and more trouble getting rid of content farms and, while trying to do so, it impacts some good sites at the same time. The author claims search will be made obsolete by social networks. I disagree, I cannot see how social networks will help routinely find information when you need it.

X.T: Google's Big Problem They Don't Want You To Know About

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google is making 96% of his revenues from AdSense and this business is slowing down.

X.T: Android, Java, and the tech behind Oracle v. Google (FAQ)
X.ST: Wondering what the lawyers and programmers are talking about in the highest-profile tech trial in years? Here's a guide to the ties between Android and Java -- and the history leading up to the case.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An overview of Oracle’s lawsuit against Google for using Java on Android.

X.T: Building New Experiences with Glass

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A demo, a presentation of the Mirror API, and some examples of applications.

X.T: Why I Left Google

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The reasons why JamesWhittaker left Google: everything was focused on Google+ to fight against Facebook, but it has lost the competition.

X.T: Google Is 2 Billion Lines of Code—And It's All in One Place
X.ST: By comparison, Microsoft Windows—one of the most complex software tools ever built for a single computer—is about 50 million lines.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Most of Google code is in a single repository: Piper.

X.T: Code Health: Google's Internal Code Quality Efforts

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A non-detailed presentation of Code Health, a group of persons dedicated to "make engineering at Google better for everyone".

X.T: Why I Quit Google to Work for Myself

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An insider view of the promotion mechanism in Google and why Lynch resigned because of it.

X.T: Data Privacy Day: seven ways we protect your privacy

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Trying to reassure users that they have some kind of privacy.

X.T: Google's Grand Plan to Eradicate Cookies Is Crumbling
X.ST: Regulators in the EU and competitors have raised concerns about the company's proposals to rewrite the rules of online advertising.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google has some trouble to get his Federated Learning of Cohorts (FLoC) accepted by other companies.

X.T: Sensenmann: Code Deletion at Scale

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information about the tool used to detect and delete dead code in Piper.

X.T: Google I/O 2009 - Practical Standards-based Security and Identity in the Enterprise

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of OAuth, first, for federated user logon and, then, for Web service authentication.

X.T: Google I/O 2009 - Bespin and the Open Web

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of Bespin and some technologies it uses: canvas and workers.

X.T: Google I/O 2010 - Ignite Google I/O

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Nine 5 minutes talks, more or less interesting: battleship, apophenia, rowing across the Atlantic…

X.T: Google I/O 2010 - Keynote Day 1 - Full Length

ARTICLE.COMMENT: HTML 5, WebM a free video format, Wave is open to everybody, GWT/Roo to quickly create application, Chrome WebStore.

X.T: Google I/O 2010 - Google Chrome's developer tools

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An introduction to the development tools available in Chrome.

X.T: Google I/O 2010 - Keynote Day 2 Android Demo - Full Length

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some demo of Froyo (Android 2.2) and some sneak peeks at future improvements.

X.T: Google I/O 2010 - Fireside chat with the Android team

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A Q&A session with the Android team.

X.T: Google I/O 2010: Google TV Keynote - Introducing Google TV

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The beginning of the GoogleTV presentation.

X.T: Google I/O 2010: Google TV Keynote, Day 2 - CEO Partner Panel

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Why some other companies (Intel, Sony…) are interested by GoogleTV.

X.T: Google I/O 2010 - Using Google Chrome Frame

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Why Google has created Chrome Frame, how to use it, some information about how it is integrated in IE…

X.T: Google I/O 2011: GIS with Google Earth and Google Maps

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of Google GIS offer: Google Map API, Fusion Tables, Earth Builder, Earth Engine… and a presentation of Arc2Cloud, a company offering services on top of Google technology.

X.T: Google I/O 2011: Map your business, inside and out

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some libraries for locating places, getting driving directions, overlaying vector-based and pixel-based data, adding marks and labels, adding 360° photos in StreetView…

X.T: Google I/O 2011: Location Based App development using Google APIs

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A detailed presentation of the Places API: search, details, real time addition/deletion, autocomplete…

X.T: Google I/O 2011: Kick-Ass Game Programming with Google Web Toolkit

ARTICLE.COMMENT:
A presentation of ForPlayhttps://github.com/fredsa/forplay
enHTML, a game development library built on top of GWT and able to generate executables for Desktop Java, HTML5 Browsers, Android, and Flash.

X.T: Google I/O 2011: Implementing Money Making SDKs

ARTICLE.COMMENT: After explaining how to use AdMob API on Android, iOS and Windows Phone 7, they present the tracking and reporting, and give some advice to display the ads.

X.T: Project Glass: Live Demo At Google I/O

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google has too much money, so it spends it doing some useless, but spectacular, demos.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Breaking the JavaScript Speed Limit with V8

ARTICLE.COMMENT: DanielClifford explains some of the optimisations done by V8 and how to write JavaScript code so it take advantage of these optimisations.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - The Web Can Do That!?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Yet another presentation about HTML5: CSS’s flexbox, CSS’s calc(), data binding, filesystem API, client-side download, transferable Objects, device APIs…

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Better Web App Development Through Tooling

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of some JavaScript development tools and of Yeoman, a set of such tools.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Google Compute Engine -- Technical Details

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some technical information about Google’s IaaS solution which has just been revealed.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - YouTube API + Cloud Rendering = Happy Mobile Gamers

ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to upload a video capture of a mobile game onto Youtube. Three options are presented: everything is done on the mobile, everything is done in the cloud, and a hybrid approach.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - What's New in Android?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A very quick presentation of the new features and a longer presentation of the Notifications (Priority, BigContentView).

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - SQL vs NoSQL: Battle of the Backends

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some criteria to decide between Cloud SQL and Datastore depending on the application you want to write.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - How we Make JavaScript Widgets Scream

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the optimisations performed on the social buttons (e.g. "+1") in order to get them loaded as fast as possible.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - The Web Platform's Cutting Edge

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An introduction to Web Components.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Dart - A Modern Web Language

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The rational for creating Dart, some of the language features, and the tools available today.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - What's New in Google Maps

ARTICLE.COMMENT: After a recall of the history of Google Maps, an overview of the new features of Google Maps, Google Places, Google Earth…

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Spatial Data Visualization

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The first half describes how to use some old and new features to display spatial data: custom markers, marker clusters, heatmaps, and symbols. The second half is about WebGL and the CanvasLayer.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Not Just a Map

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A bunch of code samples for Store Locator, custom icons, layers, custom styles, Directions, Distance Matrix, Places, Elevation, and 3D Tour.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - GRITS: PvP Gaming with HTML5

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information about a game developed as a HTML 5 game sample: authoritative server, prediction adjustment, packet grouping, atlas (aka sprites)…

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Gaming in the Cloud

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The continuation of the previous video: authentication with OAuth2, using a phone as a gamepad by reading its accelerometer, and some other details.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Use What You Know: HTML and JavaScript in Apps Script

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google Apps Script and the new HtmlService.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Maps for Good

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The presentation of some applications done on Google Maps and Google Earth: image analysis with Google Earth Engine, AXS Map to record the accessibility of places, real time elephant tracking.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Best Practices for Maps API Developers

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some advice for writing JavaScript applications using Google Maps, some are basic (use a static map if this is all you need), some are common to all JS applications (using Google Closure), some are about the latest Maps features…

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - SPDY: It's Here!

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Another high level description of SPDY.

X.T: Google I/O 2012 - Jank Busters: Building Performant Web Apps

ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to use Chrome’s Developer Tools and about:tracing to find the root causes of slow display and how to solve them.

X.T: Google I/O 2013 - Ingress: Design Principles Behind Google's Massively Multiplayer Geo Game

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The speaker, after a short presentation of the name, gives a bunch of not-so-interesting ideas about games.

X.T: Web Languages and VMs: Fast Code is Always in Fashion. (V8, Dart) - Google I/O 2013

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The first part explains some of the performance improvements of V8. The second part explains that further speed increases will be more and more difficult to implement, hence the advice to switch to Dart which is easier to optimise.

X.T: Staying off the Rocks: Using Lighthouse to Build Seaworthy Progressive Web Apps (Google I/O '17)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of Lighthouse 2.0, how to add an audit, how to integrate it in Travis…

X.T: The power of Headless Chrome and browser automation (Google I/O '18)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of Puppeteer with a some examples which are described very quickly.

X.T: The Software Revolution Behind LinkedIn's Gushing Profits
X.ST: LinkedIn took a huge risk pausing all development for two months as it switched to a turbocharged new system known as "continuous deployment." The gamble paid off big: LinkedIn now releases new web and app features twice per day, compared with once per month before. Amid a barrage of new products, its stock has more than tripled in less than two years.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: LinkedIn success is attributed to its switch to continuous deployment.

X.T: LinkedIn + Microsoft: Changing the Way the World Works

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The usual bullshit when a company is acquired by another one.

X.ST: How Linux Smashed Windows

X.T: The Halloween Documents
Open Source Software: A (New?) Development Methodology

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The original document is an internal Microsoft memo written by Valloppillil and describing the state of open source software, its dangers for Microsoft and how the company should reply. This document has leaked out of Microsoft and Raymond got a copy, he added some comments on it.
